result.execSummary:
The defendant Anita L Sciame was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 15CM344, On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $ 579 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $679; due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 4/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 2 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, to be on payment plan with case 15CT124.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2. the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence concurrent to 15CT124

--0 days credit for time already served given

--To submit a DNA Sample upon demand

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

02-04-2016 - The Court orders the Judgment of Convictions be amended to reflect 3 days sentence credit on this case.

Cases 15CM344 & 15CT124 called together at 11:46 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Anita Lucille Sciame in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CT124, Counts #1 & #2-15CM344; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3-15CT124

15CT124, On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--To pay fine of $350 + costs = $1379 + $56.74 blood testing fees (JESO) = $1435.74; due in $50 increments per month beginning 4/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 5 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive - to be on payment plan with case 15CM344.
--Revocation of drivers license for 16 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 16 months 
--6 demerit points assessed
APPLY $150 CASH BOND

15CM344, On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $ 579 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $679; due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 4/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 2 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, to be on payment plan with case 15CT124.

On Count #2. the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence concurrent to 15CT124
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $443 (includes DNA); due in $50 increments per month beginning 4/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 3 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive, to be on payment plan with case 15CT124.
--To submit a DNA Sample upon demand
Recess: 12:22 pm

NEXT: (1) Atty Svehlek to submit stipulation on sentence credit
State's with Cover Letter

Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD
As to Case 15CM344 and 15CT124

Cases 15CM344 and 15CT124 called together at 1:24pm [mo]

Defendant Anita L Sciame appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Ms. Sciame is eligible for SPD representation. 

As to Case 15CM344 (Initial Appearance occurs):
Ms. Sciame verifies date of birth on Criminal Complaint
Atty. Svehlek provides an updated address, County Road BN Stoughton
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a new $150  CASH bond to cover both case 15CM344 and 15CT124, with conditions:
--As to Case 15CM344: No Contact with Chadwick Sciame except as may be necessary in family court proceedings
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or package houses
--no operation on a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--no acts or threats of violence

The Court quashes the warrants in both cases. 
recess 1:37  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/20/16 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 1/29/16 at 11:00am
